Carpet as a green roof: Lay down a layer of carpet on top of a flat roof, add soil and plants, and you have an instant green roof that helps to insulate the building and reduce energy consumption.
Carpet as a sound barrier: Cut up old carpet into small pieces and use it to create a sound barrier in areas where noise levels are high, such as near highways or airports.
Carpet as a playground surface: Lay down a thick layer of carpet in a playground area to provide a soft, cushioned surface for children to play on.
Carpet as a garden path: Use carpet to create a unique and colorful garden path that adds texture and visual interest to your outdoor space.
Carpet as a wall covering: Cut carpet into strips and use it to cover the walls of a room, creating a unique and cozy atmosphere.
